headline.main: THE MAILS BY THE CANADA.; Destructive Gales cn the British Coast. Another Letter from Mr. Golden on Maritime Law. New-Granadian Ports to be Blockaded by a British Squadron. RUSSIAN FREPARATIONS TO SUPPORT PERSIA AGAINST ENGLAND. The Late Heavy Gales off the British Coast--Accident to the America--Wreck of Several American Vessels. Second Letter from air.Cabden on Maritime Law. Backing Out of the Georgin Railroad Hoax. The Ports of New Granada to be Immediately Blockaded by a British Squadron. Russian Preparations to Support Persia against England. Return of Dr. Livingston, the African Traveler.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Canada's mails from Boston reached this City about 1 o'clock yesterday morning. Our London files are to the 12th inst., two days later than those received by the Baltic. Further investigation has been made into the fraud alleged to have been committed upon the Great Northern Railway Company of England by REDPATH and KENT. The defalcations are now not expected to exceed ??150,000.

headline.main: NICARAGUAN AFFAIRS.; General Cazneau and Mr. John McKeon Interesting Correspondence.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: Mr. District-Attorney McKEON having led the way in publishing our correspondence, I avail myself of this official precedent to offer the press my reply to his letter, and to correct a few of his remarkable-I will not say willful-misapprehensions.
docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: Mr. District-Attorney McKEON having led the way in publishing our correspondence, I avail myself of this official precedent to offer the press my reply to his letter, and to correct a few of his remarkable-I...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Holiday season has not, the past year or two, produced any original illustrated work of importance, in this country, with the exception of DARLEY's Margaret, which can hardly be classed among Holiday productions. It is not particularly creditable to American art, that the plates of the two most elegantly-illustrated books published on this side the Atlantic were executed in Europe.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Canada brings intelligence of the death of Father MATHEW, the distinguished Apostle of Temperance. He died in the City of Cork on the 9th of December, at the age of 66. Rev. THEOBOLD MATHEW was born in Thomastown, Ireland, on the 10th of Octobor, 1790;

docs.lead_paragraph: GEORGE PEABODY, Esq., was on Tuesday evening the guest of JAMES M. BEEBEE, Esq., President of the Boston Board of Trade, who entertained also a large company of merchants, bankers and leading business men of Massachusetts.
docs.snippet: GEORGE PEABODY, Esq., was on Tuesday evening the guest of JAMES M. BEEBEE, Esq., President of the Boston Board of Trade, who entertained also a large company of merchants, bankers and leading business men of Massachusetts.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. McMAHON, the new Fifth-avenue debutante, having been mercilessly criticized by the Buffalo papers, on the occasion of her first appearance on the boards in that city, her husband, Mr. D. McMAHON, writes a long and highly indignant letter from this city to the Buffalo Courier, remonstrating against the comments of the editors.
docs.abstract: The letter of Gov. Grimes a hoax

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Board of Councilmen. Coroners' Inquests. The Board of Supervisors. Correction Removal of Quarautine. The Board of Aldermen.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Executive Committee appointed at a meeting of leading citizens of New-York, Brooklyn and Jersey City held in November last, to concert moasures for the removal of Quarantino from its present location to Sandy Hook, met yesterday at 3 P. M., at No. 51 Wall-Street. All the members of the Committee were in attendance, ex-Alderman BENSON Chairman.

headline.main: THE NEW-ENGLAND FESTIVAL.; The May-Flower in Full Bloom. TOASTS, &c. A Table Speech from Col. Thomas H. Benton. TOASTS, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New-Englanders in New-York celebrated the One Hundred and Thirty-second Anniversary of the landing of the Pilgrims with unusual enthusiasm last night. There was the regular dinner of the New England Society at the Astor House, and a ball and supper at the Lafarge Hotel, the latter by the New England Association.
docs.abstract: Speech at the N. E. Dinner. N.Y.
